articles.author: DAVID BAUDER
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Computer-generated writers ... writing computer-generated stories? Sports Illustrated is the latest media company to see its reputation damaged by being less than forthcoming — if not outright dishonest — about who or what is writing its stories at the dawn of the artificial intelligence age.
articles.title: Sports Illustrated is the latest media company damaged by an AI experiment gone wrong

articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA, JACK JEFFERY and MELANIE LIDMAN
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — International mediators on Wednesday worked to extend the truce in Gaza, encouraging Hamas militants to keep freeing hostages in exchange for the release of Palestinian prisoners and further relief from Israel's air and ground offensive.
articles.title: Last planned release of hostages in Gaza begins, as mediators aim to extend Israel-Hamas truce

articles.author: MARI YAMAGUCHI and TARA COPP
articles.description: TOKYO (AP) — A U.S. Air Force Osprey based in Japan crashed during a training mission Wednesday off of the country's southern coast, killing at least one of the eight crew members, the Japanese coast guard said.
articles.title: US Air Force Osprey crashes off Japan during training, killing at least one of the eight on board

articles.author: ERIC TUCKER and ALANNA DURKIN RICHER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Donald Trump has embraced the rioters who attacked the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021, as patriots, vowed to pardon a large portion of them if he wins a second term and even collaborated on a song with a group of jailed defendants.
articles.title: Trump embraces the Jan. 6 rioters on the trail. In court, his lawyers hope to distance him from them

articles.author: LARRY NEUMEISTER and ASHOK SHARMA
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — An Indian government official directed a $100,000 plot to assassinate a prominent Sikh separatist leader in New York City after the man advocated to establish a sovereign state for Sikhs, U.S.
articles.title: Indian official plotted to assassinate Sikh separatist leader in New York, US prosecutors say

articles.author: MIKE STOBBE
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — U.S. life expectancy rose last year — by more than a year — but still isn't close to what it was before the COVID-19 pandemic. The 2022 rise was mainly due to the waning pandemic, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention researchers said Wednesday.
articles.title: US life expectancy rose last year, but it remains below its pre-pandemic level

articles.author: BILL BARROW
articles.description: PLAINS, Ga. (AP) — Her frail husband a silent witness, Rosalynn Carter was celebrated by her family and closest friends Wednesday at her funeral in the same tiny town where she and Jimmy Carter were born, forever their home base as they climbed to the White House and traveled the world for humanitarian causes.
articles.title: Rosalynn Carter is eulogized before family and friends as husband Jimmy bears silent witness

articles.author: DAVID BAUDER
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Computer-generated writers ... writing computer-generated stories? Sports Illustrated is the latest media company to see its reputation damaged by being less than forthcoming — if not outright dishonest — about who or what is writing its stories at the dawn of the artificial intelligence age.
articles.title: Sports Illustrated is the latest media company damaged by an AI experiment gone wrong

articles.author: TIFFANY STANLEY and LEA SKENE
articles.description: BALTIMORE (AP) — As Charles Richardson gradually lost his eyesight to complications from diabetes, certain childhood memories haunted him even more. The Catholic priest appeared vividly in his mind’s eye — the one who promised him a spot on a travel basketball team, took him out for burgers and helped him with homework.
articles.title: In the US, Black survivors are nearly invisible in the Catholic clergy sexual abuse crisis

articles.author: BINAJ GURUBACHARYA
articles.description: KATHMANDU, Nepal (AP) — A gay couple in Nepal on Wednesday became the first in the nation to receive official same-sex marriage status. The Himalayan nation is one of the first in Asia to allow it.
articles.title: Gay couple in Nepal becomes the 1st to officially register same-sex marriage in the country
